ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Principals of MRI, PET, and other imaging systems
Details of MRI, PET, and other imaging and biosensing modalities
Insights into different imaging techniques and the science and math behind them. Gain knowledge of why use one type of imaging over another depending on the goal of the experiment.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
I enjoyed the practicums.

It seemed like this course was heavily targeted towards students who will be using MRI in their research but it did not feel as applicable to others.

I wish the general housekeeping of the course would be more organized and expectations more clearly communicated (understanding of course that this is a transitionary time for the course introducing the practicum piece)

I enjoyed the practicum, the hands on prompts allows for a better understanding of how what we learn in lecture actually works. I thought the problem sets and problem sessions was a good amount of homework and easy access to professors if we had questions. 

To improve the course I would try and contain the practicum within the designated class time. I would also encourage it to be in person, as we are not interactive over zoom. Even with the second session on Thursdays, often we wouldn't have started by that time to ask questions. If it was held in person I feel it would be a better use of everyones time. The outline of the schedule could also be improved. It was confusing to know the deadlines of different assignments.

Homework was always confusing and hints and clarification was always needed. The lectures were too much material and higher level then what was needed to answer homework and exams. 

Practicums did help with understanding but sometimes didn't align with the lectures. Sometimes felt like an extra class and help session was too soon from the practicum lecture.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I think the idea of the course is good, just needs some time to sort out the housekeeping matters of the course and would be good
Yes, the workload is not overwhelming and it's a good introduction to a wide variety of imaging techniques.
No, too much information all at once.
